trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can configure <token>secondref_acs</token> service identities using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal (for more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>) or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: You can configure <token>secondref_acs</token> service identities using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal (for more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>) or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Working with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can be more efficient if you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or if you want to automate the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.
trans-unit.target: Working with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can be more efficient if you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or if you want to automate the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.

trans-unit.source: Steps for Configuring Service Identities Using the ACS Management Service
trans-unit.target: Steps for Configuring Service Identities Using the ACS Management Service

trans-unit.source: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.
trans-unit.target: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure service identities using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure service identities using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect ACS Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect ACS Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to collect the necessary configuration information.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to collect the necessary configuration information.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: To collect ACS configuration information
trans-unit.target: To collect ACS configuration information

trans-unit.source: Launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.

trans-unit.source: You can use the default <ui>ManagementClient</ui> account.
trans-unit.target: You can use the default <ui>ManagementClient</ui> account.

trans-unit.source: To view this value, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui> under the <ui>Administration</ui> section in the tree on the left-hand side of the page.
trans-unit.target: To view this value, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui> under the <ui>Administration</ui> section in the tree on the left-hand side of the page.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account password.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account password.

trans-unit.source: To view this value, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To view this value, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui> under the <ui>Administration</ui> section in the tree on the left-hand side of the page.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui> under the <ui>Administration</ui> section in the tree on the left-hand side of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Management Service</ui> page, click <ui>ManagementClient</ui> under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Management Service</ui> page, click <ui>ManagementClient</ui> under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Management Service Account</ui> page, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Management Service Account</ui> page, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Management Credential</ui> page, copy the value in the <ui>Password</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Management Credential</ui> page, copy the value in the <ui>Password</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the value of your Azure namespace.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the value of your Azure namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the Azure portal or from the URL of your <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the Azure portal or from the URL of your <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For example, in http://contoso.accesscontrol.windows.net, the value of the Azure namespace is <system>contoso</system>.
trans-unit.target: For example, in http://contoso.accesscontrol.windows.net, the value of the Azure namespace is <system>contoso</system>.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> hostname.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the value of the <token>secondref_acs</token> hostname.

trans-unit.source: Usually, it is <ui>accesscontrol.windows.net</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Usually, it is <ui>accesscontrol.windows.net</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Create a sample console application
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Create a sample console application

trans-unit.source: In this step you create a sample console application that can run the code for adding your <token>secondref_acs</token> service identities.
trans-unit.target: In this step you create a sample console application that can run the code for adding your <token>secondref_acs</token> service identities.

trans-unit.source: To create a sample console application
trans-unit.target: To create a sample console application

trans-unit.source: Open <token>vs_current_long</token> and create a new console application project.
trans-unit.target: Open <token>vs_current_long</token> and create a new console application project.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class and then assign serviceIdentityPasswordForManagement, serviceNamespace, and acsHostName variables to the appropriate configuration information that you collected in the step above.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class and then assign serviceIdentityPasswordForManagement, serviceNamespace, and acsHostName variables to the appropriate configuration information that you collected in the step above.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: In this step you identify and add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.
trans-unit.target: In this step you identify and add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.

trans-unit.source: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies
trans-unit.target: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies

trans-unit.source: Right-click <ui>References</ui>, click <ui>Add Reference</ui>, and add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <ui>References</ui>, click <ui>Add Reference</ui>, and add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.

trans-unit.source: You might have to right-click your sample console application name in the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, select <ui>Properties</ui>, and change the target framework of your sample application from <ui>.NET Framework 4 Client Profile</ui> (assigned by default when you create a new console application) to <ui>.NET Framework 4</ui>.
trans-unit.target: You might have to right-click your sample console application name in the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, select <ui>Properties</ui>, and change the target framework of your sample application from <ui>.NET Framework 4 Client Profile</ui> (assigned by default when you create a new console application) to <ui>.NET Framework 4</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click <ui>Service References</ui>, click <ui>Add Service Reference</ui>, and add a service reference to the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <ui>Service References</ui>, click <ui>Add Service Reference</ui>, and add a service reference to the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service
trans-unit.target: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service

trans-unit.source: Add the following declarations, where <userInput>MyConsoleApplication</userInput> is the name of your console application and <userInput>MyServiceReference</userInput> is the name of your service reference:
trans-unit.target: Add the following declarations, where <userInput>MyConsoleApplication</userInput> is the name of your console application and <userInput>MyServiceReference</userInput> is the name of your service reference:

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client

trans-unit.source: In this step you implement the Management Service client.
trans-unit.target: In this step you implement the Management Service client.

trans-unit.source: To implement the Management Service client
trans-unit.target: To implement the Management Service client

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class to create <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class to create <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.

trans-unit.source: <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> and its helpers add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> and its helpers add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Add a Service Identity
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Add a Service Identity

trans-unit.source: In this step you add a service identity using the Management Service client you created in the step above.
trans-unit.target: In this step you add a service identity using the Management Service client you created in the step above.

trans-unit.source: ACS service identity can use a password, a symmetric key, or an X.509 certificate as a credential type.
trans-unit.target: ACS service identity can use a password, a symmetric key, or an X.509 certificate as a credential type.

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity associated with a password and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity associated with a password and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” and set its password to “SampleServiceIdentityPassword” as shown in the code below.
trans-unit.target: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” and set its password to “SampleServiceIdentityPassword” as shown in the code below.

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity associated with a symmetric key and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity associated with a symmetric key and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” and set its symmetric key value to “SampleServiceIdentityPassword” as shown in the code below.
trans-unit.target: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” and set its symmetric key value to “SampleServiceIdentityPassword” as shown in the code below.

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity associated with an X.509 certificate and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity associated with an X.509 certificate and save changes, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” as shown in the code below
trans-unit.target: You can call this service identity “SampleServiceIdentity” as shown in the code below

trans-unit.source: In the code below, replace "Full path to your .CER file" with the fully qualified path to your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: In the code below, replace "Full path to your .CER file" with the fully qualified path to your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a certificate called ACS2ClientCertificate.cer is saved in C:\, the correct value is "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.cer".
trans-unit.target: For example, if a certificate called ACS2ClientCertificate.cer is saved in C:\, the correct value is "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.cer".
